Title: Blob storage tool returns 404 error when listing containers
Body:
When using the MCP server to list containers, I get a 404 error:

Error: Container not found
StatusCode: 404
ErrorCode: ContainerNotFound

I've verified that:
- The storage account exists
- The container name is correct
- Permissions are set correctly with Storage Blob Data Reader role

This works fine when using Azure Portal or Azure CLI, but fails through the MCP storage tool.

Title: Server stops shortly after startup due to telemetry initialization failure
Body:
When running the MCP server (using the Fabric server configuration), the process exits a few seconds after startup with the following error:

System.InvalidOperationException: Telemetry service has not been initialized. Use InitializeAsync() before any other operations.
 at Azure.Mcp.Core.Services.Telemetry.TelemetryService.CheckInitialization()
 at Azure.Mcp.Core.Services.Telemetry.TelemetryService.StartActivity()
 at Azure.Mcp.Core.Commands.CommandFactory.Execute()

This happens even when following the standard setup steps.

I have confirmed:
- The Fabric MCP server was set up according to the installation guide
- The environment uses .NET SDK 9.0.305 on Windows 11
- No custom configuration overrides were applied

Expected behavior: The server should start normally without requiring manual telemetry initialization.

Title: Authentication fails when connecting to Azure Key Vault via MCP
Body:
I'm trying to use the MCP Key Vault tool to retrieve secrets, but authentication consistently fails with:

Azure.Identity.CredentialUnavailableException: DefaultAzureCredential failed to retrieve a token

Steps to reproduce:
1. Configure MCP server with Key Vault tool enabled
2. Set AZURE_KEY_VAULT_URL environment variable
3. Attempt to retrieve a secret using the get-secret tool
4. Authentication fails

I've verified the Key Vault exists and I have 'Key Vault Secrets User' role assigned.

Title: MCP ARM tool fails to list resources in subscription
Body:
When using the Azure Resource Manager tool to list resources, I get an error:

Error: Failed to list resources
The client does not have authorization to perform action 'Microsoft.Resources/subscriptions/resources/read'

I'm authenticated with Azure CLI and have Contributor role on the subscription. The same query works with 'az resource list'.

Title: Cosmos DB tool timeout when querying large collections
Body:
The MCP Cosmos DB tool times out when querying collections with more than 10k documents:

Error: Request timeout
Operation timed out after 30000ms

Query: SELECT * FROM c WHERE c.status = 'active'

The same query works fine in Data Explorer. Is there a way to increase the timeout or enable pagination?

Title: MCP server crashes on startup with TypeScript error
Body:
The MCP server fails to start with the following error:

TypeError: Cannot read property initialize of undefined at Server.start (server.ts:45)

Environment:
- Node.js v18.17.0
- MCP Server v1.0.0
- OS: macOS 14.0

This started happening after updating to the latest version.

Title: Azure SQL tool connection string parsing error
Body:
When configuring the SQL database tool, the connection string is not parsed correctly:

Error: Invalid connection string format
Parameter 'Server' is required

Connection string format used:
Server=tcp:myserver.database.windows.net,1433;Database=mydb;Authentication=Active Directory Default;

This is the standard Azure SQL connection string format.

Title: App Configuration tool fails to retrieve feature flags
Body:
The MCP App Configuration tool can retrieve key-values but fails when trying to get feature flags:

Error: Feature flag 'MyFeature' not found
Status: 404

The feature flag exists in the App Configuration store and is accessible via Azure Portal. Regular key-values work fine.

Title: Service Bus tool message peek returns empty array
Body:
When using the Service Bus tool to peek messages from a queue, it always returns an empty array even though messages are visible in Azure Portal:

const messages = await serviceBus.peekMessages('myqueue', 10);
console.log(messages); // []  

Queue has 100+ messages. Using Receiver role for authentication.

Title: Event Grid tool subscription creation fails with validation error
Body:
Creating an event subscription via the MCP Event Grid tool fails:

Error: Event subscription validation failed
The webhook endpoint did not respond with a valid validation response

The webhook endpoint is publicly accessible and responds correctly to manual tests. Event type filter: Microsoft.Storage.BlobCreated

Title: Application Insights tool query returns incorrect time range
Body:
When querying Application Insights data with the MCP monitoring tool, the time range filter is not applied correctly:

Query: requests | where timestamp > ago(1h)
Result: Returns data from the past 24 hours instead of 1 hour

The same query works correctly in Azure Portal Log Analytics.

Title: Error when copying blob to Cosmos DB via MCP tools
Body:
I'm trying to copy data from Blob Storage to Cosmos DB using MCP tools, but the operation fails:

1. Download blob using storage tool - works fine
2. Parse JSON content - works fine  
3. Insert into Cosmos DB - fails with 'Partition key missing'

The blob data includes the partition key field. Is this a known limitation when chaining tools?
Notes: Multiple tools mentioned, but Cosmos is the failure point

Title: Add support for Azure Functions in MCP
Body:
It would be great to have an MCP tool for managing Azure Functions:

- List functions in a function app
- Invoke functions with test payloads
- View function logs
- Update function settings

This would complement the existing ARM tool nicely.
Notes: Feature request - no existing tool involved

Title: Cannot access Azure Files share through storage tool
Body:
The MCP storage tool seems to only work with Blob Storage. When I try to access an Azure Files share, I get:

Error: Resource type not supported

Is Azure Files supported, or is this only for Blob Storage?
Notes: Storage tool - Files vs Blobs clarification needed

Title: Environment variables not loaded when MCP server starts
Body:
Environment variables defined in .env file are not being loaded by the MCP server:

AZURE_TENANT_ID=xxx
AZURE_CLIENT_ID=yyy  
AZURE_CLIENT_SECRET=zzz

The server starts but authentication fails because these values are undefined. Do I need to explicitly load them?

Title: All MCP tools fail with network timeout in corporate environment
Body:
Running MCP server behind corporate proxy causes all Azure tools to timeout:

Error: connect ETIMEDOUT

I've set HTTP_PROXY and HTTPS_PROXY environment variables. Azure CLI works fine with the same proxy settings. Is there additional proxy configuration needed for MCP?
Notes: Network/proxy configuration issue affecting all tools
